body_html:
Note that you are comparing GPU implementation with CPU implementation. Not sure what expected speed of GPU SVD is, but some algorithms run faster on CPU.

You can compare CPU vs CPU implementation by setting CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES= before running your test. I believe numpy is still faster here because CPU implementation of SVD in TF is single core.
body_text:
Note that you are comparing GPU implementation with CPU implementation. Not sure what expected speed of GPU SVD is, but some algorithms run faster on CPU.
You can compare CPU vs CPU implementation by setting CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES= before running your test. I believe numpy is still faster here because CPU implementation of SVD in TF is single core.
body:
Note that you are comparing GPU implementation with CPU implementation. Not sure what expected speed of GPU SVD is, but some algorithms run faster on CPU.

You can compare CPU vs CPU implementation by setting `CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=` before running your test. I believe numpy is still faster here because CPU implementation of SVD in TF is single core.
